content.raw:
I think we should consult some proposed ROS standards for aerial vehicles, since it includes quite a bit about coordinate frame transformations:

* http://www.ros.org/reps/rep-0147.html (draft)
* http://discourse.ros.org/t/proposed-standard-interface-for-aerial-vehicles-in-ros/287
content.html:
I think we should consult some proposed ROS standards for aerial vehicles, since it includes quite a bit about coordinate frame transformations:

  • http://www.ros.org/reps/rep-0147.html (draft)
  • http://discourse.ros.org/t/proposed-standard-interface-for-aerial-vehicles-in-ros/287

content.raw: Code coverage is about 90% in case you want to add a few more tests.
content.html: Code coverage is about 90% in case you want to add a few more tests.

content.raw: See previous comment about test coverage.

Minor detail: This default case is going to be hard to cover by our coverage tests. If we want to increase the coverage we could remove it, although is a little bit more defensive if we leave it. If in the future we add a new type to `CoordinateType` and we forget to add a block for the new type in this function, the error will show up. Up to you.
content.html: Minor detail: This default case is going to be hard to cover by our coverage tests. If we want to increase the coverage we could remove it, although is a little bit more defensive if we leave it. If in the future we add a new type to CoordinateType and we forget to add a block for the new type in this function, the error will show up. Up to you.

content.raw: Minor detail: This `default` case is going to be hard to cover by our coverage tests. If we want to increase the coverage we could remove it, although is a little bit more defensive if we leave it. If in the future we add a new type to `SurfaceType` and we forget to add a block for the new type in this function, the error will show up. Up to you.
content.html: Minor detail: This default case is going to be hard to cover by our coverage tests. If we want to increase the coverage we could remove it, although is a little bit more defensive if we leave it. If in the future we add a new type to SurfaceType and we forget to add a block for the new type in this function, the error will show up. Up to you.

content.raw: It seems that this function works with velocities and not with positions. Should we make it clear in the function name and doxygen? `LocalLinVelFromGlobal`? `LocalFromGlobalLinVel`?
content.html: It seems that this function works with velocities and not with positions. Should we make it clear in the function name and doxygen? LocalLinVelFromGlobal? LocalFromGlobalLinVel?

content.raw: It's not evident to me with the name of the function that this is operating with velocities. `GlobalLinVelFromLocal`?
content.html: It's not evident to me with the name of the function that this is operating with velocities. GlobalLinVelFromLocal?
